佌字的基本解释

佌
cǐ
〔佌佌〕小。

佌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cǐ］
［《廣韻》雌氏切，上紙，清。］
小。《管子·轻重乙》：“天子中立，地方千里，兼霸之壤三百有餘里，佌諸侯度百里。”章炳麟《检论·地治》：“近世所謂雙立君主者也，方伯連率則聯邦已，大者謂之兼霸之壤，小者謂之佌諸侯。”一说佌通“齊”，“佌諸侯”为“齊諸侯”，即列侯。見马非百《〈管子·轻重篇〉新诠》。

佌字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　佌； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页98第06
【廣韻】雌氏切【集韻】【韻會】淺氏切，?音此。【爾雅·釋訓】佌佌，小也。【註】材器細陋也。【詩·小雅】佌佌彼有屋。【六書故】猶差差也。言其鱗比之意。　又想氏切，音徒。義同。　又同?。【說文】引《詩》佌佌作??。

佌字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
佌字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
petty
cǐ
〔佌佌] Small.
petty
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cǐ］
["Guangyun" female clan cut, put on paper, clear. ]
small. "Guanzi·Qingzhongyi": "The emperor is neutral, the place is thousands of miles, and the land of hegemony is more than three hundred miles, and the princes are more than three hundred miles." Zhang Binglin, "Inspection Theory · Land Rule": "The so-called dual monarch in modern times is also the rate of Fang Bolian Then the federation is already, the big one is called the land of both hegemony, and the small one is called the non-princes." When it is said that the "non-princes" are "Qi", the "non-princes" are "Qi princes", that is, Liehou. See Ma Feibai's New Interpretation of "Guanzi·Light and Heavy".
petty
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　佌; Kangxi Strokes: 7; Page Number: Page 98 Page 06
[Guangyun] Fei’s cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Qian’s cut, sound this. 【Erya·Shixun】Never, small. [Note] The materials are fine and crude. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Never have a house. [Six Books] It's still bad. It means that scales are comparable.　I want to cut again, sound disciple. The same meaning. And with?. [Said the text] Quoting "Poetry" is not the same as the author??.
